italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K + italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K roman_log italic_K ) ) . end_CELL end_ROW (18)

This implies that the bounds on NC1, NC2 and NC3 in (2), (4) and (5), respectively, hold with κ⁢(WL)𝜅subscript𝑊𝐿\kappa(W_{L})italic_κ ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) upper bounded as above and ϵ2=0subscriptitalic-ϵ20\epsilon_{2}=0italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 0.

The assumption that the parameters of the nonlinear part can be chosen to fit the labels Y𝑌Yitalic_Y is guaranteed for large enough width (i) by relying on any traditional approximation result (Hornik et al., 1989; Leshno et al., 1993; Arora et al., 2018a; He et al., 2018), or (ii) by taking the infinite time limit of any convergence results (Nguyen & Mondelli, 2020), or (iii) by taking the limit λ↘0↘𝜆0\lambda\searrow 0italic_λ ↘ 0 in Proposition 4.5. A sketch of the arguments is below, with full proofs deferred to Appendix B.

Proof sketch.

To prove Proposition 5.1, we write the norm of the linear and nonlinear parts of the network in terms of the conditioning of WL:L1+1subscript𝑊:𝐿subscript𝐿11W_{L:L_{1}+1}italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L : italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT: for the linear part, this is a direct computation; for the nonlinear part, we use Theorem 1 of Dai et al. (2021), which lower bounds the norm of the parameters in terms of the product of the singular values, and then manipulate the latter quantity to obtain again the desired conditioning. Next, to prove Theorem 5.2, we pick the parameters of the nonlinear part θn⁢o⁢n⁢l⁢i⁢nsubscript𝜃𝑛𝑜𝑛𝑙𝑖𝑛\theta_{nonlin}italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n italic_o italic_n italic_l italic_i italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT s.t. ZL1=Ysubscript𝑍subscript𝐿1𝑌Z_{L_{1}}=Yitalic_Z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_Y and ‖θn⁢o⁢n⁢l⁢i⁢n‖22=csuperscriptsubscriptnormsubscript𝜃𝑛𝑜𝑛𝑙𝑖𝑛22𝑐\|\theta_{nonlin}\|_{2}^{2}=c∥ italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n italic_o italic_n italic_l italic_i italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_c, and set the linear layers to the identity. This leads to a total parameter norm of K⁢L2+c𝐾subscript𝐿2𝑐KL_{2}+citalic_K italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_c and a regularized cost of λ2⁢(K⁢L2+c)𝜆2𝐾subscript𝐿2𝑐\frac{\lambda}{2}(KL_{2}+c)divide start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ( italic_K italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_c ), and it forces the global minimizer to satisfy the assumptions of Proposition 5.1, which gives the claim on κ⁢(WL:L1+1)𝜅subscript𝑊:𝐿subscript𝐿11\kappa(W_{L:L_{1}+1})italic_κ ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L : italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). Then, as all local minimizers have balanced linear layers, κ⁢(WL)=κ⁢(WL:L1+1)1L1𝜅subscript𝑊𝐿𝜅superscriptsubscript𝑊:𝐿subscript𝐿111subscript𝐿1\kappa(W_{L})=\kappa(W_{L:L_{1}+1})^{\frac{1}{L_{1}}}italic_κ ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_κ ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L : italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, which gives (18). Finally, the claim on NC1, NC2 and NC3 follows from an application of Theorem 3.1.

5.2 Large Learning Rates

Previous works have observed that the learning rates used in practice are typically ‘too large’, i.e. the loss may not always be strictly decreasing and GD diverges from gradient flow (Cohen et al., 2021). Thankfully, instead of simply diverging, for large η𝜂\etaitalic_η (but not too large) the parameters naturally end up at the ‘edge of stability’: the top eigenvalue of the Hessian ℋ⁢Cλℋsubscript𝐶𝜆\mathcal{H}C_{\lambda}caligraphic_H italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is close to 2η2𝜂\frac{2}{\eta}divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_η end_ARG, i.e., the threshold below which GD is stable (Cohen et al., 2021; Lewkowycz et al., 2020). One can thus interpret GD with learning rate η𝜂\etaitalic_η as minimizing the cost Cλsubscript𝐶𝜆C_{\lambda}italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT amongst parameters θ𝜃\thetaitalic_θ such that ‖ℋ⁢Cλ‖o⁢p<2ηsubscriptnormℋsubscript𝐶𝜆𝑜𝑝2𝜂\left\|\mathcal{H}C_{\lambda}\right\|_{op}<\frac{2}{\eta}∥ caligraphic_H italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_o italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_η end_ARG. These observations are supported by strong empirical evidence and have been also proved theoretically for simple models (Damian et al., 2022), although a general result remains difficult to prove due to the chaotic behavior of GD for large η𝜂\etaitalic_η. Specifically, the Hessian has the form

ℋ⁢Cλ⁢(θ)=(∇θZL)⊤⁢∂θZL+Tr⁢[(Y−ZL)⁢∇θ2ZL]+λ⁢IP,ℋsubscript𝐶𝜆𝜃superscriptsubscript∇𝜃subscript𝑍𝐿topsubscript𝜃subscript𝑍𝐿Trdelimited-[]𝑌subscript𝑍𝐿superscriptsubscript∇𝜃2subscript𝑍𝐿𝜆subscript𝐼𝑃\mathcal{H}C_{\lambda}(\theta)=\left(\nabla_{\theta}Z_{L}\right)^{\top}% \partial_{\theta}Z_{L}+\mathrm{Tr}\left[(Y-Z_{L})\nabla_{\theta}^{2}Z_{L}% \right]+\lambda I_{P},caligraphic_H italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ ) = ( ∇ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⊤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∂ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + roman_Tr [ ( italic_Y - italic_Z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ∇ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] + italic_λ italic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , (19)

with ∇θZL∈ℝP×N⁢Ksubscript∇𝜃subscript𝑍𝐿superscriptℝ𝑃𝑁𝐾\nabla_{\theta}Z_{L}\in\mathbb{R}^{P\times NK}∇ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_P × italic_N italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and P𝑃Pitalic_P the number of parameters. The first term is the Fisher information matrix: this is dual to the Neural Tangent Kernel (NTK) Θ=∇θZL⁢(∇θZL)⊤∈ℝN⁢K×N⁢KΘsubscript∇𝜃subscript𝑍𝐿superscriptsubscript∇𝜃subscript𝑍𝐿topsuperscriptℝ𝑁𝐾𝑁𝐾\Theta=\nabla_{\theta}Z_{L}\left(\nabla_{\theta}Z_{L}\right)^{\top}\in\mathbb{% R}^{NK\times NK}roman_Θ = ∇ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ∇ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⊤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∈ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N italic_K × italic_N italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT (Jacot et al., 2018). Therefore, at approximately interpolating points, we have ‖ℋ⁢Cλ⁢(θ)‖o⁢p=‖Θ‖o⁢p+O⁢(ϵ1)+O⁢(λ)subscriptnormℋsubscript𝐶𝜆𝜃𝑜𝑝subscriptnormΘ𝑜𝑝𝑂subscriptitalic-ϵ1𝑂𝜆\left\|\mathcal{H}C_{\lambda}(\theta)\right\|_{op}=\left\|\Theta\right\|_{op}+% O(\epsilon_{1})+O(\lambda)∥ caligraphic_H italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ ) ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_o italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ∥ roman_Θ ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_o italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_O ( italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_O ( italic_λ ), where ϵ1subscriptitalic-ϵ1\epsilon_{1}italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is the interpolation error and λ𝜆\lambdaitalic_λ the regularization parameter. We can thus interpret large learning as forcing a bound on the operator norm of the NTK. For networks that approximately interpolate the data with bounded NTK and bounded weights, the following proposition guarantees good conditioning of the weights in the linear part (and therefore NC2-3).

Proposition 5.3.

For any network that satisfies

  • •

    bounded NTK, i.e., ‖Θ‖o⁢p=maxA‖∇θTr⁢[ZL⁢AT]‖22‖A‖F2≤C⁢L2subscriptnormΘ𝑜𝑝subscriptmax𝐴superscriptsubscriptnormsubscript∇𝜃Trdelimited-[]subscript𝑍𝐿superscript𝐴𝑇22superscriptsubscriptnorm𝐴𝐹2𝐶subscript𝐿2\left\|\Theta\right\|_{op}=\mathop{\rm max}\nolimits_{A}\frac{\left\|\nabla_{% \theta}\mathrm{Tr}\left[Z_{L}A^{T}\right]\right\|_{2}^{2}}{\left\|A\right\|_{F% }^{2}}\leq CL_{2}∥ roman_Θ ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_o italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG ∥ ∇ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Tr [ italic_Z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG ∥ italic_A ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ≤ italic_C italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT,

  • •

    approximate interpolation, i.e., ‖ZL−Y‖F≤ϵ1subscriptnormsubscript𝑍𝐿𝑌𝐹subscriptitalic-ϵ1\left\|Z_{L}-Y\right\|_{F}\leq\epsilon_{1}∥ italic_Z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_Y ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT,

  • •

    bounded weights, i.e., ‖Wℓ‖o⁢p≤rsubscriptnormsubscript𝑊ℓ𝑜𝑝𝑟\left\|W_{\ell}\right\|_{op}\leq r∥ italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ℓ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_o italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ italic_r,

for any M≤L2𝑀subscript𝐿2M\leq L_{2}italic_M ≤ italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, there is ℓ∈{L1+1,…,L1+M}ℓsubscript𝐿11…subscript𝐿1𝑀\ell\in\{L_{1}+1,\dots,L_{1}+M\}roman_ℓ ∈ { italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 , … , italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_M } such that κ⁢(WL:ℓ)≤C⁢L2⁢K⁢rM⁢(sK⁢(Y)−ϵ1)𝜅subscript𝑊:𝐿ℓ𝐶subscript𝐿2𝐾𝑟𝑀subscript𝑠𝐾𝑌subscriptitalic-ϵ1\kappa(W_{L:\ell})\leq\frac{\sqrt{CL_{2}}Kr}{\sqrt{M}\left(s_{K}(Y)-\epsilon_{% 1}\right)}italic_κ ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L : roman_ℓ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ≤ divide start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_C italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG italic_K italic_r end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_M end_ARG ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_Y ) - italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG.

Furthermore, any network that satisfies approximate interpolation and bounded weights is such that

‖Θ‖o⁢p≥(sK⁢(Y)−ϵ1)2K2⁢r2⁢L2.subscriptnormΘ𝑜𝑝superscriptsubscript𝑠𝐾𝑌subscriptitalic-ϵ12superscript𝐾2superscript𝑟2subscript𝐿2\left\|\Theta\right\|_{op}\geq\frac{\left(s_{K}(Y)-\epsilon_{1}\right)^{2}}{K^% {2}r^{2}}L_{2}.∥ roman_Θ ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_o italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≥ divide start_ARG ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_Y ) - italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_r start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . (20)

As an example, by choosing M=L22𝑀subscript𝐿22M=\frac{L_{2}}{2}italic_M = divide start_ARG italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG, we guarantee that there is at least one layer ℓℓ\ellroman_ℓ in the first half of the linear layers s.t.  κ⁢(WL:ℓ)≤2⁢C⁢K⁢rsK⁢(Y)−ϵ1𝜅subscript𝑊:𝐿ℓ2𝐶𝐾𝑟subscript𝑠𝐾𝑌subscriptitalic-ϵ1\kappa(W_{L:\ell})\leq\frac{\sqrt{2C}Kr}{s_{K}(Y)-\epsilon_{1}}italic_κ ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L : roman_ℓ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ≤ divide start_ARG square-root start_ARG 2 italic_C end_ARG italic_K italic_r end_ARG start_ARG italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_Y ) - italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG. Now, assuming the ‘edge of stability’ phenomenon, a learning rate of η=η0L2𝜂subscript𝜂0subscript𝐿2\eta=\frac{\eta_{0}}{L_{2}}italic_η = divide start_ARG italic_η start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG implies a bound ‖Θ‖o⁢p≤‖ℋ⁢Cλ‖o⁢p+O⁢(ϵ1)+O⁢(λ)≤2⁢L2η0+O⁢(ϵ1)+O⁢(λ)subscriptnormΘ𝑜𝑝subscriptnormℋsubscript𝐶𝜆𝑜𝑝𝑂subscriptitalic-ϵ1𝑂𝜆2subscript𝐿2subscript𝜂0𝑂subscriptitalic-ϵ1𝑂𝜆\left\|\Theta\right\|_{op}\leq\left\|\mathcal{H}C_{\lambda}\right\|_{op}+O(% \epsilon_{1})+O(\lambda)\leq\frac{2L_{2}}{\eta_{0}}+O(\epsilon_{1})+O(\lambda)∥ roman_Θ ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_o italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ ∥ caligraphic_H italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_o italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_O ( italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_O ( italic_λ ) ≤ divide start_ARG 2 italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_η start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG + italic_O ( italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_O ( italic_λ ), and thus Proposition 5.3 implies that there is a linear layer with bounded conditioning. Proposition 5.3 also suggests that one cannot take any significantly larger learning rate, since for any parameters that ϵ1subscriptitalic-ϵ1\epsilon_{1}italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-interpolate and have r𝑟ritalic_r-bounded weights, the NTK satisfies the lower bound in (20), which implies that the learning rate must be smaller than 2⁢r2⁢K2L2⁢(sK⁢(Y)−ϵ1)22superscript𝑟2superscript𝐾2subscript𝐿2superscriptsubscript𝑠𝐾𝑌subscriptitalic-ϵ12\frac{2r^{2}K^{2}}{L_{2}\left(s_{K}(Y)-\epsilon_{1}\right)^{2}}divide start_ARG 2 italic_r start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_Y ) - italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG.

Proof sketch.

The idea is that, by suitably choosing A𝐴Aitalic_A in the evaluation of ‖∇θTr⁢[ZL⁢AT]‖22‖A‖F2superscriptsubscriptnormsubscript∇𝜃Trdelimited-[]subscript𝑍𝐿superscript𝐴𝑇22superscriptsubscriptnorm𝐴𝐹2\frac{\left\|\nabla_{\theta}\mathrm{Tr}\left[Z_{L}A^{T}\right]\right\|_{2}^{2}% }{\left\|A\right\|_{F}^{2}}divide start_ARG ∥ ∇ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Tr [ italic_Z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG ∥ italic_A ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG, the operator norm of the NTK is lower bounded by some constant times ∑ℓ=L1+1Lκ⁢(WL:ℓ)2superscriptsubscriptℓsubscript𝐿11𝐿𝜅superscriptsubscript𝑊:𝐿ℓ2\sum_{\ell=L_{1}+1}^{L}\kappa(W_{L:\ell})^{2}∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ℓ = italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_κ ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L : roman_ℓ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. This implies the desired upper bound on κ⁢(WL:ℓ)𝜅subscript𝑊:𝐿ℓ\kappa(W_{L:\ell})italic_κ ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L : roman_ℓ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) for some ℓ∈{L1+1,…,L1+M}ℓsubscript𝐿11…subscript𝐿1𝑀\ell\in\{L_{1}+1,\ldots,L_{1}+M\}roman_ℓ ∈ { italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 , … , italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_M }, as well as the lower bound on ‖Θ‖o⁢psubscriptnormΘ𝑜𝑝\|\Theta\|_{op}∥ roman_Θ ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_o italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT in (20). The details are deferred to Appendix B.

6 Numerical Results

In all experiments, we consider MSE loss and standard weight decay regularization. We train an MLP and a ResNet20 with an added MLP head on standard datasets (MNIST, CIFAR10), considering as backbone the first two layers for the MLP and the whole architecture before the linear head for the ResNet. We evaluate the following metrics related to neural collapse: for NC1, we compute tr⁢(ΣW)/tr⁢(ΣB),trsubscriptΣ𝑊trsubscriptΣ𝐵\text{tr}(\Sigma_{W})/\text{tr}(\Sigma_{B}),tr ( roman_Σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_W end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) / tr ( roman_Σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , where ΣW,ΣBsubscriptΣ𝑊subscriptΣ𝐵\Sigma_{W},\Sigma_{B}roman_Σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_W end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , roman_Σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT are the within- and between-class variability matrices of the feature matrices, respectively; for NC2, we display the conditioning number of the class-mean matrix; for NC3, we use the average cosine angle between the rows of a weight matrix and the columns of the preceding class-mean matrix. Finally, for balancedness we use ‖Wℓ+1⊤⁢Wℓ+1−Wℓ⁢Wℓ⊤‖o⁢pmin{‖Wℓ+1⊤⁢Wℓ+1‖o⁢p,‖Wℓ⁢Wℓ⊤‖o⁢p}subscriptnormsuperscriptsubscript𝑊ℓ1topsubscript𝑊ℓ1subscript𝑊ℓsuperscriptsubscript𝑊ℓtop𝑜𝑝minsubscriptnormsuperscriptsubscript𝑊ℓ1topsubscript𝑊ℓ1𝑜𝑝subscriptnormsubscript𝑊ℓsuperscriptsubscript𝑊ℓtop𝑜𝑝\frac{\left\|W_{\ell+1}^{\top}W_{\ell+1}-W_{\ell}W_{\ell}^{\top}\right\|_{op}}% {\mathop{\rm min}\nolimits\left\{\left\|W_{\ell+1}^{\top}W_{\ell+1}\right\|_{% op},\left\|W_{\ell}W_{\ell}^{\top}\right\|_{op}\right\}}divide start_ARG ∥ italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ℓ + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⊤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ℓ + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ℓ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ℓ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⊤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_o italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG roman_min { ∥ italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ℓ + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⊤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ℓ + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_o italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ∥ italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ℓ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ℓ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⊤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_o italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } end_ARG and for negativity we use ‖Zℓ−σ⁢(Zℓ)‖o⁢p‖Zℓ‖o⁢p.subscriptnormsubscript𝑍ℓ𝜎subscript𝑍ℓ𝑜𝑝subscriptnormsubscript𝑍ℓ𝑜𝑝\frac{\left\|Z_{\ell}-\sigma(Z_{\ell})\right\|_{op}}{\left\|Z_{\ell}\right\|_{% op}}.divide start_ARG ∥ italic_Z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ℓ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_σ ( italic_Z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ℓ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_o italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG ∥ italic_Z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ℓ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_o italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG . We measure such metrics (and also index the layers) starting from the output of the backbone. Our findings can be summarized as follows (see Appendix A for additional complementary experiments).

The deeper the linear head, the more clear NC occurs.

We first test whether the models with deep linear heads exhibit NC and if that’s the case, whether it gets better as we deepen the linear head. In Figure 1, we show the NC metrics and the gram matrices of the class-mean matrices of the last layers for the training on CIFAR10 of ResNet20 with 6 extra layers of which the first three have a ReLU activation. We use weight decay of 0.0010.0010.0010.001 and learning rate of 0.0010.0010.0010.001, training for 5000 epochs (the learning rate drops ten-fold after 80% of the epochs in all our experiments).

The plot clearly shows that the collapse is reached throughout the training. We also see that the NC2 metric improves progressively with each layer of the linear head, as predicted by our theory. This effect is also clearly visible from the gram matrices of the class-means (bottom row of Figure 1), which rapidly converge towards the identity. We note that these findings are remarkably consistent across a wide variety of hyperparameter settings and architectures.

In Figure 2, we plot the dependence of the NC metrics on the number of layers in the linear head. We train an MLP on MNIST with 5 non-linear layers and a number of linear layers ranging from 1 to 5. We average over 5 runs per each combination of weight decay (0.001,0.0040.0010.0040.001,0.0040.001 , 0.004) and with learning rate of 0.0010.0010.0010.001. We also train the ResNet20 on CIFAR10 with one non-linear layer head and 1 to 6 linear layers on top. We use the same weight decay and learning rate. The relatively high variance of the results is due to averaging over rather strongly different weight decay values used per each depth. The plots clearly show that the NC2 significantly improves in the last layer as the depth of the linear head increases, while it gets slightly worse in the input layer to the linear head. This is consistent with our theory. The NC1 does not have a strong dependence with the number of layers.

Linear layers are increasingly balanced throughout training.

Figure 1 shows that the metric capturing the balancedness exponentially decreases until it plateaus at a rather small value (due to the large learning rate) and then again it exponentially decreases at a smaller rate after reducing the learning rate. The balancedness of non-linear layers instead plateaus at a significantly larger value.

Non-linear layers are increasingly balanced and linear, as the depth of the non-linear part increases.

In Figure 3, we show the dependence of balancedness and non-linearity of the non-linear layers as a function of the depth of the non-linear part. In particular, we plot minimum balancedness and non-linearity across all layers, as well as mean balancedness and non-linearity. The depth of the non-linear part ranges from 4 to 12 (the first two layers are considered as backbone and not measured), the learning rate is either 0.0010.0010.0010.001 or 0.0020.0020.0020.002 (5 runs each), and the weight decay is 0.0160.0160.0160.016 divided by the total number of layers. Balancedness clearly improves with depth, both on average per layer and in the most balanced layer. Similarly, the non-negativity of the layer that least uses the ReLU clearly decreases, and a decrease in the mean negativity is also reported (although less pronounced). Thus, these results suggest that the network tends to use non-linearities less as the depth increases and, in addition, it becomes more balanced. We also note that, in order to fit the data, regardless of the depth, the last non-linear layer(s) always exhibit significant negativity, heavily relying on the ReLU.

Neither the European Union nor the granting authority can be held responsible for them.

  • Zangrando et al. (2024) Emanuele Zangrando, Piero Deidda, Simone Brugiapaglia, Nicola Guglielmi, and Francesco Tudisco. Neural rank collapse: Weight decay and small within-class variability yield low-rank bias. arXiv preprint arXiv:2402.03991, 2024.
  • Zhang et al. (2024) Jiawei Zhang, Yufan Chen, Cheng Jin, Lei Zhu, and Yuantao Gu. EPA: neural collapse inspired robust out-of-distribution detector. arXiv preprint arXiv:2401.01710, 2024.
  • Zhou et al. (2022a) Jinxin Zhou, Xiao Li, Tianyu Ding, Chong You, Qing Qu, and Zhihui Zhu. On the optimization landscape of neural collapse under MSE loss: Global optimality with unconstrained features. In International Conference on Machine Learning (ICML), 2022a.
  • Zhou et al. (2022b) Jinxin Zhou, Chong You, Xiao Li, Kangning Liu, Sheng Liu, Qing Qu, and Zhihui Zhu. Are all losses created equal: A neural collapse perspective. In Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems (NeurIPS), 2022b.
  • Zhu et al. (2021) Zhihui Zhu, Tianyu Ding, Jinxin Zhou, Xiao Li, Chong You, Jeremias Sulam, and Qing Qu. A geometric analysis of neural collapse with unconstrained features. In Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems (NeurIPS), 2021.
  • Zou & Gu (2019) Difan Zou and Quanquan Gu. An improved analysis of training over-parameterized deep neural networks. In Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems (NeurIPS), 2019.

Appendix A Additional Experiments

We complement the experiments from Section 6 with additional numerical findings. We start by showing an analog of Figure 1 for MLP trained on MNIST to show that the behavior is robust with respect to the backbone and dataset. The results are shown in Figure 4. The architecture is an MLP with 5 non-linear layers followed by 4 linear layers. We use weight decay of 0.00180.00180.00180.0018 and learning rate of 0.0010.0010.0010.001, training for 10000 epochs.

The plot fully agrees with the one in Figure 1 with ResNet20 training on CIFAR10 in every qualitative aspect, and it only differs in the numerical values attained by the NC metrics. Therefore, the conclusion is that the NC is attained across different architectures and NC2 progressively improves as we get closer to the last layer of the DNN.

Next, we extend Figure 2 with experiments on ResNet20 trained on MNIST, which are shown in Figure 5. As above, the results match the interpretations discussed in Section 6, which proves the robustness of our findings across different achitectures, datasets and hyperparameter settings.

Appendix B Deferred Proofs

See 3.1

Proof.

NC1: We start by proving the claim (2) on NC1. We have

sK⁢(Y)−ϵ1≤sK⁢(Y+(ZL−Y))=sK⁢(ZL)=sK⁢(WL⁢ZL−1)≤sK⁢(WL)⁢r.subscript𝑠𝐾𝑌subscriptitalic-ϵ1subscript𝑠𝐾𝑌subscript𝑍𝐿𝑌subscript𝑠𝐾subscript𝑍𝐿subscript𝑠𝐾subscript𝑊𝐿subscript𝑍𝐿1subscript𝑠𝐾subscript𝑊𝐿𝑟s_{K}(Y)-\epsilon_{1}\leq s_{K}(Y+(Z_{L}-Y))=s_{K}(Z_{L})=s_{K}(W_{L}Z_{L-1})% \leq s_{K}(W_{L})r.italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_Y ) - italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_Y + ( italic_Z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_Y ) ) = italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_Z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ≤ italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_r . (21)

Denote WL+superscriptsubscript𝑊𝐿W_{L}^{+}italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT the pseudoinverse of WL.subscript𝑊𝐿W_{L}.italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . Note that

‖WL+⁢(ZL−Y)‖F≤ϵ1⁢rsK⁢(Y)−ϵ1,subscriptnormsuperscriptsubscript𝑊𝐿subscript𝑍𝐿𝑌𝐹subscriptitalic-ϵ1𝑟subscript𝑠𝐾𝑌subscriptitalic-ϵ1\left\|W_{L}^{+}(Z_{L}-Y)\right\|_{F}\leq\frac{\epsilon_{1}r}{s_{K}(Y)-% \epsilon_{1}},∥ italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_Z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_Y ) ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ divide start_ARG italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r end_ARG start_ARG italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_Y ) - italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ,

Putting these together, we have:

≥(1K⁢∑c=1K‖μcY−μGY‖2−1K⁢∑c=1K‖μcY−μcL‖2−‖μGY−μGL‖2)2,absentsuperscript1𝐾superscriptsubscript𝑐1𝐾subscriptnormsuperscriptsubscript𝜇𝑐𝑌superscriptsubscript𝜇𝐺𝑌21𝐾superscriptsubscript𝑐1𝐾subscriptnormsuperscriptsubscript𝜇𝑐𝑌superscriptsubscript𝜇𝑐𝐿2subscriptnormsuperscriptsubscript𝜇𝐺𝑌superscriptsubscript𝜇𝐺𝐿22\displaystyle\geq\left(\frac{1}{K}\sum_{c=1}^{K}\left\|\mu_{c}^{Y}-\mu_{G}^{Y}% \right\|_{2}-\frac{1}{K}\sum_{c=1}^{K}\left\|\mu_{c}^{Y}-\mu_{c}^{L}\right\|_{% 2}-\left\|\mu_{G}^{Y}-\mu_{G}^{L}\right\|_{2}\right)^{2},≥ ( divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_K end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_K end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - ∥ italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ,

where μcY,μGYsuperscriptsubscript𝜇𝑐𝑌superscriptsubscript𝜇𝐺𝑌\mu_{c}^{Y},\mu_{G}^{Y}italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT are the class and global means of the label matrix Y.𝑌Y.italic_Y . A direct computation yields that 1K⁢∑c=1K‖μcY−μGY‖=K−1K.1𝐾superscriptsubscript𝑐1𝐾normsuperscriptsubscript𝜇𝑐𝑌superscriptsubscript𝜇𝐺𝑌𝐾1𝐾\frac{1}{K}\sum_{c=1}^{K}\left\|\mu_{c}^{Y}-\mu_{G}^{Y}\right\|=\sqrt{\frac{K-% 1}{K}}.divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_K end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ = square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG italic_K - 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_K end_ARG end_ARG . Next we have:

≤1N⁢∑c,i‖zc⁢iL−zc⁢iY‖22=1N⁢‖ZL−Y‖F≤ϵ1N.absent1𝑁subscript𝑐𝑖superscriptsubscriptnormsuperscriptsubscript𝑧𝑐𝑖𝐿superscriptsubscript𝑧𝑐𝑖𝑌221𝑁subscriptnormsubscript𝑍𝐿𝑌𝐹subscriptitalic-ϵ1𝑁\displaystyle\leq\sqrt{\frac{1}{N}\sum_{c,i}\left\|z_{ci}^{L}-z_{ci}^{Y}\right% \|_{2}^{2}}=\frac{1}{\sqrt{N}}\left\|Z_{L}-Y\right\|_{F}\leq\frac{\epsilon_{1}% }{\sqrt{N}}.≤ square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_N end_ARG end_ARG ∥ italic_Z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_Y ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ divide start_ARG italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_N end_ARG end_ARG .

Finally, for any fixed c𝑐citalic_c we have

‖μcY−μcL‖2=‖1n⁢∑izc⁢iY−1n⁢∑izc⁢iL‖2≤1n⁢∑i‖zc⁢iY−zc⁢iL‖2.subscriptnormsuperscriptsubscript𝜇𝑐𝑌superscriptsubscript𝜇𝑐𝐿2subscriptnorm1𝑛subscript𝑖superscriptsubscript𝑧𝑐𝑖𝑌1𝑛subscript𝑖superscriptsubscript𝑧𝑐𝑖𝐿21𝑛subscript𝑖subscriptnormsuperscriptsubscript𝑧𝑐𝑖𝑌superscriptsubscript𝑧𝑐𝑖𝐿2\displaystyle\left\|\mu_{c}^{Y}-\mu_{c}^{L}\right\|_{2}=\left\|\frac{1}{n}\sum% _{i}z_{ci}^{Y}-\frac{1}{n}\sum_{i}z_{ci}^{L}\right\|_{2}\leq\frac{1}{n}\sum_{i% }\left\|z_{ci}^{Y}-z_{ci}^{L}\right\|_{2}.∥ italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ∥ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_n end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_n end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_n end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

Therefore we get:

1K⁢∑c=1K‖μcY−μcL‖2≤1N⁢∑c,i‖zc⁢iY−zc⁢iL‖2≤1N⁢‖ZL−Y‖F≤ϵ1N.1𝐾superscriptsubscript𝑐1𝐾subscriptnormsuperscriptsubscript𝜇𝑐𝑌superscriptsubscript𝜇𝑐𝐿21𝑁subscript𝑐𝑖subscriptnormsuperscriptsubscript𝑧𝑐𝑖𝑌superscriptsubscript𝑧𝑐𝑖𝐿21𝑁subscriptnormsubscript𝑍𝐿𝑌𝐹subscriptitalic-ϵ1𝑁\displaystyle\frac{1}{K}\sum_{c=1}^{K}\left\|\mu_{c}^{Y}-\mu_{c}^{L}\right\|_{% 2}\leq\frac{1}{N}\sum_{c,i}\left\|z_{ci}^{Y}-z_{ci}^{L}\right\|_{2}\leq\frac{1% }{\sqrt{N}}\left\|Z_{L}-Y\right\|_{F}\leq\frac{\epsilon_{1}}{\sqrt{N}}.divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_K end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_N end_ARG end_ARG ∥ italic_Z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_Y ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ divide start_ARG italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_N end_ARG end_ARG .

Upper bounding these terms in the above computation and dividing tr⁢(ΣW)trsubscriptΣ𝑊\text{tr}(\Sigma_{W})tr ( roman_Σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_W end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) by tr⁢(ΣB)trsubscriptΣ𝐵\text{tr}(\Sigma_{B})tr ( roman_Σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) yields (2).

Conditioning of WLsubscript𝑊𝐿W_{L}italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT: We now prove the claim (3) on the conditioning of WLsubscript𝑊𝐿W_{L}italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. We rely first on Lemma C.2 to relate the singular values of WLsubscript𝑊𝐿W_{L}italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT to the L2subscript𝐿2L_{2}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-th root of those of WL:L1+1subscript𝑊:𝐿subscript𝐿11W_{L:L_{1}+1}italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L : italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. We therefore obtain that

s1⁢(WL)2⁢L2sK⁢(WL)2⁢L2subscript𝑠1superscriptsubscript𝑊𝐿2subscript𝐿2subscript𝑠𝐾superscriptsubscript𝑊𝐿2subscript𝐿2\displaystyle\frac{s_{1}(W_{L})^{2L_{2}}}{s_{K}(W_{L})^{2L_{2}}}divide start_ARG italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ≤s1⁢(WL:L1+1)2+L222⁢r2⁢(L2−1)⁢ϵ2sK⁢(WL:L1+1)2−L222⁢r2⁢(L2−1)⁢ϵ2absentsubscript𝑠1superscriptsubscript𝑊:𝐿subscript𝐿112superscriptsubscript𝐿222superscript𝑟2subscript𝐿21subscriptitalic-ϵ2subscript𝑠𝐾superscriptsubscript𝑊:𝐿subscript𝐿112superscriptsubscript𝐿222superscript𝑟2subscript𝐿21subscriptitalic-ϵ2\displaystyle\leq\frac{s_{1}(W_{L:L_{1}+1})^{2}+\frac{L_{2}^{2}}{2}r^{2(L_{2}-% 1)}\epsilon_{2}}{s_{K}(W_{L:L_{1}+1})^{2}-\frac{L_{2}^{2}}{2}r^{2(L_{2}-1)}% \epsilon_{2}}≤ divide start_ARG italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L : italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + divide start_ARG italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG italic_r start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - =s1⁢(WL:L1+1)2sK⁢(WL:L1+1)2+sK⁢(WL:L1+1)2⁢L222⁢r2⁢(L2−1)⁢ϵ2+s1⁢(WL:L1+1)2⁢L222⁢r2⁢(L2−1)⁢ϵ2(sK⁢(WL:L1+1)2−L222⁢r2⁢(L2−1)⁢ϵ2)⁢sK⁢(WL:L1+1)2.absentsubscript𝑠1superscriptsubscript𝑊:𝐿subscript𝐿112subscript𝑠𝐾superscriptsubscript𝑊:𝐿subscript𝐿112subscript𝑠𝐾superscriptsubscript𝑊:𝐿subscript𝐿112superscriptsubscript𝐿222superscript𝑟2subscript𝐿21subscriptitalic-ϵ2subscript𝑠1superscriptsubscript𝑊:𝐿subscript𝐿112superscriptsubscript𝐿222superscript𝑟2subscript𝐿21subscriptitalic-ϵ2subscript𝑠𝐾superscriptsubscript𝑊:𝐿subscript𝐿112superscriptsubscript𝐿222superscript𝑟2subscript𝐿21subscriptitalic-ϵ2subscript𝑠𝐾superscriptsubscript𝑊:𝐿subscript𝐿112\displaystyle=\frac{s_{1}(W_{L:L_{1}+1})^{2}}{s_{K}(W_{L:L_{1}+1})^{2}}+\frac{% s_{K}(W_{L:L_{1}+1})^{2}\frac{L_{2}^{2}}{2}r^{2(L_{2}-1)}\epsilon_{2}+s_{1}(W_% {L:L_{1}+1})^{2}\frac{L_{2}^{2}}{2}r^{2(L_{2}-1)}\epsilon_{2}}{\left(s_{K}(W_{% L:L_{1}+1})^{2}-\frac{L_{2}^{2}}{2}r^{2(L_{2}-1)}\epsilon_{2}\right)s_{K}(W_{L% :L_{1}+1})^{2}}.= divide start_ARG italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L : italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L : italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG + divide start_ARG italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L : italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG italic_r start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - We have that

sK⁢(ZL)≤sK⁢(WL:L1+1)⁢‖ZL1‖o⁢p≤sK⁢(WL:L1+1)⁢‖X‖o⁢p⁢rL1,subscript𝑠𝐾subscript𝑍𝐿subscript𝑠𝐾subscript𝑊:𝐿subscript𝐿11subscriptnormsubscript𝑍subscript𝐿1𝑜𝑝subscript𝑠𝐾subscript𝑊:𝐿subscript𝐿11subscriptnorm𝑋𝑜𝑝superscript𝑟subscript𝐿1s_{K}(Z_{L})\leq s_{K}(W_{L:L_{1}+1})\left\|Z_{L_{1}}\right\|_{op}\leq s_{K}(W% _{L:L_{1}+1})\left\|X\right\|_{op}r^{L_{1}},italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_Z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ≤ italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L : italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ∥ italic_Z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_o italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L : italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ∥ italic_X ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_o italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ,

and therefore

sK⁢(WL:L1+1)≥sK⁢(ZL)‖X‖o⁢p⁢rL1≥sK⁢(Y)−ϵ1‖X‖o⁢p⁢rL1.subscript𝑠𝐾subscript𝑊:𝐿subscript𝐿11subscript𝑠𝐾subscript𝑍𝐿subscriptnorm𝑋𝑜𝑝superscript𝑟subscript𝐿1subscript𝑠𝐾𝑌subscriptitalic-ϵ1subscriptnorm𝑋𝑜𝑝superscript𝑟subscript𝐿1s_{K}(W_{L:L_{1}+1})\geq\frac{s_{K}(Z_{L})}{\left\|X\right\|_{op}r^{L_{1}}}% \geq\frac{s_{K}(Y)-\epsilon_{1}}{\left\|X\right\|_{op}r^{L_{1}}}.italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L : italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ≥ divide start_ARG italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_Z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG ∥ italic_X ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_o italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ≥ divide start_ARG italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_Y ) - italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG ∥ italic_X ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_o italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG .

This gives that

Thus, the following chain of inequalities gives (3):

NC(2+3): We start with the proof of the claim (5) on NC3, as the derivations will be used in the proof of the claim (4) on NC2 later. Since the cosine similarity does not depend on the scale of the involved matrices, we perform the following rescaling: denoting α=‖WL‖𝛼normsubscript𝑊𝐿\alpha=\left\|W_{L}\right\|italic_α = ∥ italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥, we define WL′=WLαsuperscriptsubscript𝑊𝐿′subscript𝑊𝐿𝛼W_{L}^{\prime}=\frac{W_{L}}{\alpha}italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = divide start_ARG italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_α end_ARG and ZL−1′=α⁢ZL−1.superscriptsubscript𝑍𝐿1′𝛼subscript𝑍𝐿1Z_{L-1}^{\prime}=\alpha Z_{L-1}.italic_Z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_α italic_Z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . =∥ZL−1′∥F2+∥(WL′)⊤⁢Y∥F2−∥ZL−1′−(WL′)⊤⁢Y∥F22⁢N⁢κ⁢(WL)⁢(1+ϵ1).absentsuperscriptsubscriptdelimited-∥∥subscriptsuperscript𝑍′𝐿1𝐹2superscriptsubscriptdelimited-∥∥superscriptsubscriptsuperscript𝑊′𝐿top𝑌𝐹2superscriptsubscriptdelimited-∥∥subscriptsuperscript𝑍′𝐿1superscriptsubscriptsuperscript𝑊′𝐿top𝑌𝐹22𝑁𝜅subscript𝑊𝐿1subscriptitalic-ϵ1\displaystyle=\frac{\left\lVert Z^{\prime}_{L-1}\right\rVert_{F}^{2}+\left% \lVert(W^{\prime}_{L})^{\top}Y\right\rVert_{F}^{2}-\left\lVert Z^{\prime}_{L-1% }-(W^{\prime}_{L})^{\top}Y\right\rVert_{F}^{2}}{2N\kappa(W_{L})(1+\epsilon_{1}% )}.= divide start_ARG ∥ italic_Z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + ∥ ( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⊤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - ∥ italic_Z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - ( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⊤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_N italic_κ ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ( 1 + italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG .

Here, the first inequality follows from upper bounding ∥(WL′)c:∥2subscriptdelimited-∥∥subscriptsubscriptsuperscript𝑊′𝐿:𝑐absent2\left\lVert(W^{\prime}_{L})_{c:}\right\rVert_{2}∥ ( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT trivially by 1 and

∥(z′)c⁢i(L−1)∥2≤κ⁢(WL)⁢∥zc⁢i(L)∥2≤κ⁢(WL)⁢(∥yc−zc⁢i(L)∥2+∥yc∥2)≤κ⁢(WL)⁢(1+ϵ1).subscriptdelimited-∥∥subscriptsuperscriptsuperscript𝑧′𝐿1𝑐𝑖2𝜅subscript𝑊𝐿subscriptdelimited-∥∥subscriptsuperscript𝑧𝐿𝑐𝑖2𝜅subscript𝑊𝐿subscriptdelimited-∥∥subscript𝑦𝑐subscriptsuperscript𝑧𝐿𝑐𝑖2subscriptdelimited-∥∥subscript𝑦𝑐2𝜅subscript𝑊𝐿1subscriptitalic-ϵ1\left\lVert(z^{\prime})^{(L-1)}_{ci}\right\rVert_{2}\leq\kappa(W_{L})\left% \lVert z^{(L)}_{ci}\right\rVert_{2}\leq\kappa(W_{L})\left(\left\lVert y_{c}-z^% {(L)}_{ci}\right\rVert_{2}+\left\lVert y_{c}\right\rVert_{2}\right)\leq\kappa(% W_{L})(1+\epsilon_{1}).∥ ( italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_L - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ italic_κ ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ∥ italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_L ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ italic_κ ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ( ∥ italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_L ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + ∥ italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ≤ italic_κ ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ( 1 + italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) .

Now,

∥ZL−1′∥F2≥∥ZL∥F2≥(∥Y∥F−∥ZL−Y∥F)2=(N−ϵ1)2.superscriptsubscriptdelimited-∥∥subscriptsuperscript𝑍′𝐿1𝐹2superscriptsubscriptdelimited-∥∥subscript𝑍𝐿𝐹2superscriptsubscriptdelimited-∥∥𝑌𝐹subscriptdelimited-∥∥subscript𝑍𝐿𝑌𝐹2superscript𝑁subscriptitalic-ϵ12\left\lVert Z^{\prime}_{L-1}\right\rVert_{F}^{2}\geq\left\lVert Z_{L}\right% \rVert_{F}^{2}\geq\left(\left\lVert Y\right\rVert_{F}-\left\lVert Z_{L}-Y% \right\rVert_{F}\right)^{2}=(\sqrt{N}-\epsilon_{1})^{2}.∥ italic_Z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≥ ∥ italic_Z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≥ ( ∥ italic_Y ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - ∥ italic_Z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_Y ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = ( square-root start_ARG italic_N end_ARG - italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT .

Furthermore, we readily have that ∥(WL′)⊤⁢Y∥F≥Nκ⁢(WL).subscriptdelimited-∥∥superscriptsubscriptsuperscript𝑊′𝐿top𝑌𝐹𝑁𝜅subscript𝑊𝐿\left\lVert(W^{\prime}_{L})^{\top}Y\right\rVert_{F}\geq\frac{\sqrt{N}}{\kappa(% W_{L})}.∥ ( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⊤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≥ divide start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_N end_ARG end_ARG start_ARG italic_κ ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG . Finally, we have:

∥ZL−1′−(WL′)⊤⁢Y∥F≤∥ZL−1′−(WL′)+⁢Y∥F+∥(WL′)+⁢Y−(WL′)⊤⁢Y∥F.subscriptdelimited-∥∥subscriptsuperscript𝑍′𝐿1superscriptsuperscriptsubscript𝑊𝐿′top𝑌𝐹subscriptdelimited-∥∥subscriptsuperscript𝑍′𝐿1superscriptsubscriptsuperscript𝑊′𝐿𝑌𝐹subscriptdelimited-∥∥superscriptsubscriptsuperscript𝑊′𝐿𝑌superscriptsubscriptsuperscript𝑊′𝐿top𝑌𝐹\displaystyle\left\lVert Z^{\prime}_{L-1}-(W_{L}^{\prime})^{\top}Y\right\rVert% _{F}\leq\left\lVert Z^{\prime}_{L-1}-(W^{\prime}_{L})^{+}Y\right\rVert_{F}+% \left\lVert(W^{\prime}_{L})^{+}Y-(W^{\prime}_{L})^{\top}Y\right\rVert_{F}.∥ italic_Z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⊤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ ∥ italic_Z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - ( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + ∥ ( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y - ( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⊤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

From (22), we obtain that

∥ZL−1′−(WL′)+⁢Y∥F≤r2⁢(ϵ1sK⁢(Y)−ϵ1+nL−1⁢ϵ2)=r⁢Ψ⁢(ϵ1,ϵ2,r).subscriptdelimited-∥∥subscriptsuperscript𝑍′𝐿1superscriptsuperscriptsubscript𝑊𝐿′𝑌𝐹superscript𝑟2subscriptitalic-ϵ1subscript𝑠𝐾𝑌subscriptitalic-ϵ1subscript𝑛𝐿1subscriptitalic-ϵ2𝑟Ψsubscriptitalic-ϵ1subscriptitalic-ϵ2𝑟\displaystyle\left\lVert Z^{\prime}_{L-1}-(W_{L}^{\prime})^{+}Y\right\rVert_{F% }\leq r^{2}\left(\frac{\epsilon_{1}}{s_{K}(Y)-\epsilon_{1}}+\sqrt{n_{L-1}% \epsilon_{2}}\right)=r\Psi(\epsilon_{1},\epsilon_{2},r).∥ italic_Z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ italic_r start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( divide start_ARG italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_Y ) - italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG + square-root start_ARG italic_n start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) = italic_r roman_Ψ ( italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_r ) . (23)

Finally, we proceed with upper bounding ∥(WL′)+⁢Y−(WL′)⊤⁢Y∥Fsubscriptdelimited-∥∥superscriptsubscriptsuperscript𝑊′𝐿𝑌superscriptsubscriptsuperscript𝑊′𝐿top𝑌𝐹\left\lVert(W^{\prime}_{L})^{+}Y-(W^{\prime}_{L})^{\top}Y\right\rVert_{F}∥ ( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y - ( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⊤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, which can be done via a sandwich bound on the singular values using the conditioning number. This gives

∥(WL′)+⁢Y−(WL′)⊤⁢Y∥F≤K⁢(κ⁢(WL)−1κ⁢(WL))≤K⁢(κ⁢(WL)2−1).subscriptdelimited-∥∥superscriptsubscriptsuperscript𝑊′𝐿𝑌superscriptsubscriptsuperscript𝑊′𝐿top𝑌𝐹𝐾𝜅subscript𝑊𝐿1𝜅subscript𝑊𝐿𝐾𝜅superscriptsubscript𝑊𝐿21\left\lVert(W^{\prime}_{L})^{+}Y-(W^{\prime}_{L})^{\top}Y\right\rVert_{F}\leq% \sqrt{K}\left(\kappa(W_{L})-\frac{1}{\kappa(W_{L})}\right)\leq\sqrt{K}(\kappa(% W_{L})^{2}-1).∥ ( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y - ( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⊤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ square-root start_ARG italic_K end_ARG ( italic_κ ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_κ ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG ) ≤ square-root start_ARG italic_K end_ARG ( italic_κ ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 ) .

Putting all the obtained bounds together, we get the desired bound (5) on NC3.

Finally, to pass from the bound (3) on κ⁢(WL)𝜅subscript𝑊𝐿\kappa(W_{L})italic_κ ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) to the bound (4) on NC2, we use the inequality in (23) obtained in the proof of NC3. Note that obtaining a bound on κ⁢(Z¯L−1′)𝜅subscriptsuperscript¯𝑍′𝐿1\kappa(\bar{Z}^{\prime}_{L-1})italic_κ ( over¯ start_ARG italic_Z end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) is equivalent to obtaining a bound on κ⁢(Z¯L−1)𝜅subscript¯𝑍𝐿1\kappa(\bar{Z}_{L-1})italic_κ ( over¯ start_ARG italic_Z end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) since multiplying by a scalar does not change the condition number. Using (23) we get:

∥Z¯L−1′−(WL′)+∥Fsubscriptdelimited-∥∥subscriptsuperscript¯𝑍′𝐿1superscriptsubscriptsuperscript𝑊′𝐿𝐹\displaystyle\left\lVert\bar{Z}^{\prime}_{L-1}-(W^{\prime}_{L})^{+}\right% \rVert_{F}∥ over¯ start_ARG italic_Z end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - ( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F end_POSTSUBSCRIPT =∥ZL−1′⁢Y+−(WL′)+⁢Y⁢Y+∥F≤∥Y+∥o⁢p⁢∥ZL−1′−(WL′)+⁢Y∥Fabsentsubscriptdelimited-∥∥subscriptsuperscript𝑍′𝐿1superscript𝑌superscriptsubscriptsuperscript𝑊′𝐿𝑌superscript𝑌𝐹subscriptdelimited-∥∥superscript𝑌𝑜𝑝subscriptdelimited-∥∥subscriptsuperscript𝑍′𝐿1superscriptsubscriptsuperscript𝑊′𝐿𝑌𝐹\displaystyle=\left\lVert Z^{\prime}_{L-1}Y^{+}-(W^{\prime}_{L})^{+}YY^{+}% \right\rVert_{F}\leq\left\lVert Y^{+}\right\rVert_{op}\left\lVert Z^{\prime}_{% L-1}-(W^{\prime}_{L})^{+}Y\right\rVert_{F}= ∥ italic_Z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Y start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - ( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y italic_Y start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ ∥ italic_Y start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_o italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ italic_Z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - ( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
≤r⁢Ψ⁢(ϵ1,ϵ2,r)sK⁢(Y).absent𝑟Ψsubscriptitalic-ϵ1subscriptitalic-ϵ2𝑟subscript𝑠𝐾𝑌\displaystyle\leq\frac{r\Psi(\epsilon_{1},\epsilon_{2},r)}{s_{K}(Y)}.≤ divide start_ARG italic_r roman_Ψ ( italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_r ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_Y ) end_ARG .

As ‖(WL′)+‖o⁢p=κ⁢(WL)subscriptnormsuperscriptsubscriptsuperscript𝑊′𝐿𝑜𝑝𝜅subscript𝑊𝐿\|(W^{\prime}_{L})^{+}\|_{op}=\kappa(W_{L})∥ ( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_o italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_κ ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) and sK⁢((WL′)+)=1subscript𝑠𝐾superscriptsubscriptsuperscript𝑊′𝐿1s_{K}((W^{\prime}_{L})^{+})=1italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) = 1, we conclude that

κ⁢(Z¯L−1′)≤κ⁢(WL)+r⁢Ψ⁢(ϵ1,ϵ2,r)⁢(sK⁢(Y))−11−r⁢Ψ⁢(ϵ1,ϵ2,r)⁢(sK⁢(Y))−1,𝜅subscriptsuperscript¯𝑍′𝐿1𝜅subscript𝑊𝐿𝑟Ψsubscriptitalic-ϵ1subscriptitalic-ϵ2𝑟superscriptsubscript𝑠𝐾𝑌11𝑟Ψsubscriptitalic-ϵ1subscriptitalic-ϵ2𝑟superscriptsubscript𝑠𝐾𝑌1\kappa(\bar{Z}^{\prime}_{L-1})\leq\frac{\kappa(W_{L})+r\Psi(\epsilon_{1},% \epsilon_{2},r)(s_{K}(Y))^{-1}}{1-r\Psi(\epsilon_{1},\epsilon_{2},r)(s_{K}(Y))% ^{-1}},italic_κ ( over¯ start_ARG italic_Z end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ≤ divide start_ARG italic_κ ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_r roman_Ψ ( italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_r ) ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_Y ) ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_r roman_Ψ ( italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_r ) ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_Y ) ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ,

which gives the desired bound in (4).

∎

See 4.5

Proof.

Let θ∈B⁢(θ0,r0)𝜃𝐵subscript𝜃0subscript𝑟0\theta\in B(\theta_{0},r_{0})italic_θ ∈ italic_B ( italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). Then, the following chain of inequalities holds:

‖∇C0⁢(θ)+λ⁢θ‖22≥(‖∇C0⁢(θ)‖2−λ⁢‖θ‖2)2≥(α2⁢C0⁢(θ)−λ⁢‖θ‖2)2=(α2⁢Cλ⁢(θ)−α⁢λ4⁢‖θ‖22−λ⁢‖θ‖2)2≥(α2⁢Cλ⁢(θ)−(λ+α⁢λ4)⁢‖θ‖2)2≥α4⁢Cλ⁢(θ)−λ⁢(α4+λ)2⁢‖θ‖22≥α4⁢(Cλ⁢(θ)−λ⁢(1+4⁢λα)2⁢(‖θ0‖2+r0)2).superscriptsubscriptdelimited-∥∥∇subscript𝐶0𝜃𝜆𝜃22superscriptsubscriptdelimited-∥∥∇subscript𝐶0𝜃2𝜆subscriptdelimited-∥∥𝜃22superscript𝛼2subscript𝐶0𝜃𝜆subscriptdelimited-∥∥𝜃22superscript𝛼2subscript𝐶𝜆𝜃𝛼𝜆4superscriptsubscriptnorm𝜃22𝜆subscriptdelimited-∥∥𝜃22superscript𝛼2subscript𝐶𝜆𝜃𝜆𝛼𝜆4subscriptdelimited-∥∥𝜃22𝛼4subscript𝐶𝜆𝜃𝜆superscript𝛼4𝜆2superscriptsubscriptdelimited-∥∥𝜃22𝛼4subscript𝐶𝜆𝜃𝜆superscript14𝜆𝛼2superscriptsubscriptdelimited-∥∥subscript𝜃02subscript𝑟02\begin{split}\left\|\nabla C_{0}(\theta)+\lambda\theta\right\|_{2}^{2}&\geq% \left(\left\|\nabla C_{0}(\theta)\right\|_{2}-\lambda\left\|\theta\right\|_{2}% \right)^{2}\\ &\geq\left(\sqrt{\frac{\alpha}{2}C_{0}(\theta)}-\lambda\left\|\theta\right\|_{% 2}\right)^{2}\\ &=\left(\sqrt{\frac{\alpha}{2}C_{\lambda}(\theta)-\frac{\alpha\lambda}{4}\left% \|\theta\right\|_{2}^{2}}-\lambda\left\|\theta\right\|_{2}\right)^{2}\\ &\geq\left(\sqrt{\frac{\alpha}{2}C_{\lambda}(\theta)}-\left(\lambda+\sqrt{% \frac{\alpha\lambda}{4}}\right)\left\|\theta\right\|_{2}\right)^{2}\\ &\geq\frac{\alpha}{4}C_{\lambda}(\theta)-\lambda\left(\sqrt{\frac{\alpha}{4}}+% \sqrt{\lambda}\right)^{2}\left\|\theta\right\|_{2}^{2}\\ &\geq\frac{\alpha}{4}\left(C_{\lambda}(\theta)-\lambda\left(1+\sqrt{\frac{4% \lambda}{\alpha}}\right)^{2}\left(\left\|\theta_{0}\right\|_{2}+r_{0}\right)^{% 2}\right).\end{split}start_ROW start_CELL ∥ ∇ italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ ) + italic_λ italic_θ ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_CELL start_CELL ≥ ( ∥ ∇ italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ ) ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_λ ∥ italic_θ ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL end_CELL start_CELL ≥ ( square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG italic_α end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ ) end_ARG - italic_λ ∥ italic_θ ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL end_CELL start_CELL = ( square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG italic_α end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ ) - divide start_ARG italic_α italic_λ end_ARG start_ARG 4 end_ARG ∥ italic_θ ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG - italic_λ ∥ italic_θ ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL end_CELL start_CELL ≥ ( square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG italic_α end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ ) end_ARG - ( italic_λ + square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG italic_α italic_λ end_ARG start_ARG 4 end_ARG end_ARG ) ∥ italic_θ ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL end_CELL start_CELL ≥ divide start_ARG italic_α end_ARG start_ARG 4 end_ARG italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ ) - italic_λ ( square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG italic_α end_ARG start_ARG 4 end_ARG end_ARG + square-root start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ italic_θ ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL end_CELL start_CELL ≥ divide start_ARG italic_α end_ARG start_ARG 4 end_ARG ( italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ ) - italic_λ ( 1 + square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG 4 italic_λ end_ARG start_ARG italic_α end_ARG end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ∥ italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) . end_CELL end_ROW (24)

Here, in the second line we use that α2⁢C0⁢(θ)≥λ⁢‖θ‖2𝛼2subscript𝐶0𝜃𝜆subscriptnorm𝜃2\sqrt{\frac{\alpha}{2}C_{0}(\theta)}\geq\lambda\left\|\theta\right\|_{2}square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG italic_α end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ ) end_ARG ≥ italic_λ ∥ italic_θ ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, which follows from Cλ⁢(θ)≥λ⁢mλsubscript𝐶𝜆𝜃𝜆subscript𝑚𝜆C_{\lambda}(\theta)\geq\lambda m_{\lambda}italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ ) ≥ italic_λ italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (otherwise, the claim is trivial); in the fourth line we use that a−b≥a−b𝑎𝑏𝑎𝑏\sqrt{a-b}\geq\sqrt{a}-\sqrt{b}square-root start_ARG italic_a - italic_b end_ARG ≥ square-root start_ARG italic_a end_ARG - square-root start_ARG italic_b end_ARG for a≥b𝑎𝑏a\geq bitalic_a ≥ italic_b; in the fifth line we use that (a−b)2≥a22−b2superscript𝑎𝑏2superscript𝑎22superscript𝑏2(a-b)^{2}\geq\frac{a^{2}}{2}-b^{2}( italic_a - italic_b ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≥ divide start_ARG italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG - italic_b start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT for all a,b𝑎𝑏a,bitalic_a , italic_b; and in the sixth line we use that θ𝜃\thetaitalic_θ is in the ball B⁢(θ0,r0)𝐵subscript𝜃0subscript𝑟0B(\theta_{0},r_{0})italic_B ( italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). As the LHS of (24) equals ∥∇Cλ(θ))∥22\left\|\nabla C_{\lambda}(\theta))\right\|_{2}^{2}∥ ∇ italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ ) ) ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, this proves (14).

Next, let (θk)k∈ℕsubscriptsubscript𝜃𝑘𝑘ℕ(\theta_{k})_{k\in\mathbb{N}}( italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k ∈ blackboard_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT be the GD trajectory. Pick k𝑘kitalic_k s.t. θk∈B⁢(θ0,r0)subscript𝜃𝑘𝐵subscript𝜃0subscript𝑟0\theta_{k}\in B(\theta_{0},r_{0})italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ italic_B ( italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). Then,

Cλ⁢(θk+1)−Cλ⁢(θk)=−η⁢∫01⟨∇Cλ⁢(θk−s⁢η⁢∇Cλ⁢(θk)),∇Cλ⁢(θk)⟩⁢𝑑ssubscript𝐶𝜆subscript𝜃𝑘1subscript𝐶𝜆subscript𝜃𝑘𝜂superscriptsubscript01∇subscript𝐶𝜆subscript𝜃𝑘𝑠𝜂∇subscript𝐶𝜆subscript𝜃𝑘∇subscript𝐶𝜆subscript𝜃𝑘differential-d𝑠\displaystyle C_{\lambda}(\theta_{k+1})-C_{\lambda}(\theta_{k})=-\eta\int_{0}^% {1}\langle\nabla C_{\lambda}(\theta_{k}-s\eta\nabla C_{\lambda}(\theta_{k})),% \nabla C_{\lambda}(\theta_{k})\rangle dsitalic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = - italic_η ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⟨ ∇ italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_s italic_η ∇ italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) , ∇ italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ⟩ italic_d italic_s
=−η⁢‖∇Cλ⁢(θk)‖22+η⁢∫01⟨∇Cλ⁢(θk−s⁢η⁢∇Cλ⁢(θk))−∇Cλ⁢(θk),∇Cλ⁢(θk)⟩⁢𝑑sabsent𝜂superscriptsubscriptnorm∇subscript𝐶𝜆subscript𝜃𝑘22𝜂superscriptsubscript01∇subscript𝐶𝜆subscript𝜃𝑘𝑠𝜂∇subscript𝐶𝜆subscript𝜃𝑘∇subscript𝐶𝜆subscript𝜃𝑘∇subscript𝐶𝜆subscript𝜃𝑘differential-d𝑠\displaystyle=-\eta\left\|\nabla C_{\lambda}(\theta_{k})\right\|_{2}^{2}+\eta% \int_{0}^{1}\langle\nabla C_{\lambda}(\theta_{k}-s\eta\nabla C_{\lambda}(% \theta_{k}))-\nabla C_{\lambda}(\theta_{k}),\nabla C_{\lambda}(\theta_{k})% \rangle ds= - italic_η ∥ ∇ italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_η ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⟨ ∇ italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_s italic_η ∇ italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) - ∇ italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , ∇ italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ⟩ italic_d italic_s

Here, in the fourth line we use that the gradient is β1subscript𝛽1\beta_{1}italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-Lipschitz in B⁢(θ0,r0)𝐵subscript𝜃0subscript𝑟0B(\theta_{0},r_{0})italic_B ( italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ); in the sixth line we use that η<1/(2⁢β1)𝜂12subscript𝛽1\eta<1/(2\beta_{1})italic_η < 1 / ( 2 italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ); and in the last line we use (14). Thus, as long as θj∈B⁢(θ0,r0)subscript𝜃𝑗𝐵subscript𝜃0subscript𝑟0\theta_{j}\in B(\theta_{0},r_{0})italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ italic_B ( italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) for all j∈[k]𝑗delimited-[]𝑘j\in[k]italic_j ∈ [ italic_k ], by iterating the argument above, we have

Cλ⁢(θk)−λ⁢mλ≤(Cλ⁢(θ0)−λ⁢mλ)⁢(1−η⁢α8)k.subscript𝐶𝜆subscript𝜃𝑘𝜆subscript𝑚𝜆subscript𝐶𝜆subscript𝜃0𝜆subscript𝑚𝜆superscript1𝜂𝛼8𝑘C_{\lambda}(\theta_{k})-\lambda m_{\lambda}\leq\left(C_{\lambda}(\theta_{0})-% \lambda m_{\lambda}\right)\left(1-\eta\frac{\alpha}{8}\right)^{k}.italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_λ italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ ( italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_λ italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ( 1 - italic_η divide start_ARG italic_α end_ARG start_ARG 8 end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT .

This readily implies that, by letting k1subscript𝑘1k_{1}italic_k start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT be the first index k𝑘kitalic_k s.t. Cλ⁢(θk)≤2⁢λ⁢mλsubscript𝐶𝜆subscript𝜃𝑘2𝜆subscript𝑚𝜆C_{\lambda}(\theta_{k})\leq 2\lambda m_{\lambda}italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ≤ 2 italic_λ italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, (15) holds. Finally, the distance ‖θk1−θ0‖2subscriptnormsubscript𝜃subscript𝑘1subscript𝜃02\left\|\theta_{k_{1}}-\theta_{0}\right\|_{2}∥ italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is upper bounded by

≤8α⁢∑k=0k1−2Cλ⁢(θk)−Cλ⁢(θk+1)Cλ⁢(θk+1)−λ⁢mλ+Cλ⁢(θk)−λ⁢mλ+8α⁢Cλ⁢(θk1−1)−λ⁢mλCλ⁢(θk1−1)−λ⁢mλabsent8𝛼superscriptsubscript𝑘0subscript𝑘12subscript𝐶𝜆subscript𝜃𝑘subscript𝐶𝜆subscript𝜃𝑘1subscript𝐶𝜆subscript𝜃𝑘1𝜆subscript𝑚𝜆subscript𝐶𝜆subscript𝜃𝑘𝜆subscript𝑚𝜆8𝛼subscript𝐶𝜆subscript𝜃subscript𝑘11𝜆subscript𝑚𝜆subscript𝐶𝜆subscript𝜃subscript𝑘11𝜆subscript𝑚𝜆\displaystyle\leq\frac{8}{\sqrt{\alpha}}\sum_{k=0}^{k_{1}-2}\frac{C_{\lambda}(% \theta_{k})-C_{\lambda}(\theta_{k+1})}{\sqrt{C_{\lambda}(\theta_{k+1})-\lambda m% _{\lambda}}+\sqrt{C_{\lambda}(\theta_{k})-\lambda m_{\lambda}}}+\frac{8}{\sqrt% {\alpha}}\frac{C_{\lambda}(\theta_{k_{1}-1})-\lambda m_{\lambda}}{\sqrt{C_{% \lambda}(\theta_{k_{1}-1})-\lambda m_{\lambda}}}≤ divide start_ARG 8 end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_α end_ARG end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - =8α⁢∑k=0k1−2(Cλ⁢(θk)−λ⁢mλ−Cλ⁢(θk+1)−λ⁢mλ)+8α⁢Cλ⁢(θk1−1)−λ⁢mλabsent8𝛼superscriptsubscript𝑘0subscript𝑘12subscript𝐶𝜆subscript𝜃𝑘𝜆subscript𝑚𝜆subscript𝐶𝜆subscript𝜃𝑘1𝜆subscript𝑚𝜆8𝛼subscript𝐶𝜆subscript𝜃subscript𝑘11𝜆subscript𝑚𝜆\displaystyle=\frac{8}{\sqrt{\alpha}}\sum_{k=0}^{k_{1}-2}\left(\sqrt{C_{% \lambda}(\theta_{k})-\lambda m_{\lambda}}-\sqrt{C_{\lambda}(\theta_{k+1})-% \lambda m_{\lambda}}\right)+\frac{8}{\sqrt{\alpha}}\sqrt{C_{\lambda}(\theta_{k% _{1}-1})-\lambda m_{\lambda}}= divide start_ARG 8 end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_α end_ARG end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( square-root start_ARG italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_λ italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG - square-root start_ARG italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_λ italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) + divide start_ARG 8 end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_α end_ARG end_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_λ italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG
=8α⁢Cλ⁢(θ0)−λ⁢mλ≤8α⁢Cλ⁢(θ0),absent8𝛼subscript𝐶𝜆subscript𝜃0𝜆subscript𝑚𝜆8𝛼subscript𝐶𝜆subscript𝜃0\displaystyle=\frac{8}{\sqrt{\alpha}}\sqrt{C_{\lambda}(\theta_{0})-\lambda m_{% \lambda}}\leq\frac{8}{\sqrt{\alpha}}\sqrt{C_{\lambda}(\theta_{0})},= divide start_ARG 8 end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_α end_ARG end_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_λ italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ≤ divide start_ARG 8 end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_α end_ARG end_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG ,

which concludes the proof. ∎

See 4.4

Proof.

By Lemma 4.1 in (Nguyen & Mondelli, 2020), the loss C0⁢(θ)subscript𝐶0𝜃C_{0}(\theta)italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ ) satisfies the α𝛼\alphaitalic_α-PL inequality with

α=4⁢γL−2⁢σmin⁢(Z1)⁢∏p=3Lσmin⁢(Wp),𝛼4superscript𝛾𝐿2subscript𝜎minsubscript𝑍1superscriptsubscriptproduct𝑝3𝐿subscript𝜎minsubscript𝑊𝑝\alpha=4\gamma^{L-2}\sigma_{\textrm{min}}\left(Z_{1}\right)\prod_{p=3}^{L}% \sigma_{\textrm{min}}\left(W_{p}\right),italic_α = 4 italic_γ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L - 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_Z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ∏ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p = 3 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ,

where we have also used that σ′superscript𝜎′\sigma^{\prime}italic_σ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is lower bounded by γ𝛾\gammaitalic_γ by Assumption 4.2. Thus, by taking r0=12⁢min(λF,minℓ∈{3,…,L}λℓ)subscript𝑟012minsubscript𝜆𝐹subscriptminℓ3…𝐿subscript𝜆ℓr_{0}=\frac{1}{2}\mathop{\rm min}\nolimits(\lambda_{F},\mathop{\rm min}% \nolimits_{\ell\in\{3,\ldots,L\}}\lambda_{\ell})italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG roman_min ( italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ℓ ∈ { 3 , … , italic_L } end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ℓ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ), we have that, for all θ∈B⁢(θ0,r0)𝜃𝐵subscript𝜃0subscript𝑟0\theta\in B(\theta_{0},r_{0})italic_θ ∈ italic_B ( italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ), C0⁢(θ)subscript𝐶0𝜃C_{0}(\theta)italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ ) satisfies the α𝛼\alphaitalic_α-PL inequality with α=2−(L−3)⁢γL−2⁢λF⁢λ3→L𝛼superscript2𝐿3superscript𝛾𝐿2subscript𝜆𝐹subscript𝜆→3𝐿\alpha=2^{-(L-3)}\gamma^{L-2}\lambda_{F}\lambda_{3\to L}italic_α = 2 start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - ( italic_L - 3 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_γ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L - 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 3 → italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

By using Assumption 4.3 and that λ𝜆\lambdaitalic_λ is upper bounded by 2⁢C0⁢(θ0)∥θ0∥222subscript𝐶0subscript𝜃0superscriptsubscriptdelimited-∥∥subscript𝜃022\frac{2C_{0}(\theta_{0})}{\left\lVert\theta_{0}\right\rVert_{2}^{2}}divide start_ARG 2 italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG ∥ italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG in (10), one can readily verify that r0≥8⁢Cλ⁢(θ0)/αsubscript𝑟08subscript𝐶𝜆subscript𝜃0𝛼r_{0}\geq 8\sqrt{C_{\lambda}(\theta_{0})/\alpha}italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≥ 8 square-root start_ARG italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) / italic_α end_ARG. Furthermore, by Lemma C.1, we have that ∇C0⁢(θ)∇subscript𝐶0𝜃\nabla C_{0}(\theta)∇ italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ ) is β1subscript𝛽1\beta_{1}italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-Lipschitz for all θ∈B⁢(θ0,r0)𝜃𝐵subscript𝜃0subscript𝑟0\theta\in B(\theta_{0},r_{0})italic_θ ∈ italic_B ( italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). Hence, we can apply Proposition 4.5, which gives that, for some k1subscript𝑘1k_{1}italic_k start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT upper bounded in (15),

Cλ⁢(θk1)≤2⁢λ⁢mλ≤ϵ12,subscript𝐶𝜆subscript𝜃subscript𝑘12𝜆subscript𝑚𝜆superscriptsubscriptitalic-ϵ12C_{\lambda}(\theta_{k_{1}})\leq 2\lambda m_{\lambda}\leq\epsilon_{1}^{2},italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ≤ 2 italic_λ italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ,

where the last inequality uses again the upper bound on λ𝜆\lambdaitalic_λ in (10).

With gradient flow, the regularized loss would only decrease further after k1subscript𝑘1k_{1}italic_k start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT steps. Since we are working with gradient descent, we simply need to assume that the learning rate is small enough to guarantee a decreasing loss. If the gradient ∇Cλ⁢(θ)∇subscript𝐶𝜆𝜃\nabla C_{\lambda}(\theta)∇ italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ ) is β2subscript𝛽2\beta_{2}italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-Lipschitz, then

Cλ⁢(θk+1)subscript𝐶𝜆subscript𝜃𝑘1\displaystyle C_{\lambda}(\theta_{k+1})italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) −Cλ⁢(θk)=Cλ⁢(θk−η⁢∇Cλ⁢(θk))−Cλ⁢(θk)subscript𝐶𝜆subscript𝜃𝑘subscript𝐶𝜆subscript𝜃𝑘𝜂∇subscript𝐶𝜆subscript𝜃𝑘subscript𝐶𝜆subscript𝜃𝑘\displaystyle-C_{\lambda}(\theta_{k})=C_{\lambda}(\theta_{k}-\eta\nabla C_{% \lambda}(\theta_{k}))-C_{\lambda}(\theta_{k})- italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_η ∇ italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) - italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )
=−η⁢∫01⟨∇Cλ⁢(θk−s⁢η⁢∇Cλ⁢(θk)),∇Cλ⁢(θk)⟩⁢𝑑sabsent𝜂superscriptsubscript01∇subscript𝐶𝜆subscript𝜃𝑘𝑠𝜂∇subscript𝐶𝜆subscript𝜃𝑘∇subscript𝐶𝜆subscript𝜃𝑘differential-d𝑠\displaystyle=-\eta\int_{0}^{1}\left\langle\nabla C_{\lambda}(\theta_{k}-s\eta% \nabla C_{\lambda}(\theta_{k})),\nabla C_{\lambda}(\theta_{k})\right\rangle ds= - italic_η ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⟨ ∇ italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_s italic_η ∇ italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) , ∇ italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ⟩ italic_d italic_s
≤−η⁢‖∇Cλ⁢(θk)‖22absent𝜂superscriptsubscriptnorm∇subscript𝐶𝜆subscript𝜃𝑘22\displaystyle\leq-\eta\left\|\nabla C_{\lambda}(\theta_{k})\right\|_{2}^{2}≤ - italic_η ∥ ∇ italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT
